00044 
00045 /* This is the initializer for a "struct timeval" used in a select() call
00046  * right after a new request is accept()ed to determine readablity.  Its
00047  * a drop-dead timer.  Its only used for AF_UNIX sockets (not TCP sockets).
00048  * Its a workaround for a kernel bug in Linux 2.0.x and SCO Unixware.
00049  * Making this as small as possible, yet remain reliable would be best.
00050  * 2 seconds is very conservative.  0,0 is not reliable.  The shorter the
00051  * timeout, the faster request processing will recover.  The longer the
00052  * timeout, the more likely this application being "busy" will cause other
00053  * requests to abort and cause more dead sockets that need this timeout. */
00054 #define READABLE_UNIX_FD_DROP_DEAD_TIMEVAL 2,0
00055
